Once ensnared by darkness, Shadowheart’s path changed when she rejected slaying the Nightsong and embraced mercy and light. Freed from her former servitude, she became a Chosen of Selûne, guiding the lost under moonlight and hope. Selûne, goddess of the moon, stars, wanderers, and seekers, represents compassion, guidance, and enduring light. Her followers hold that even in deepest night, moonlight reveals the way forward. Selûne and her twin sister Shar embody the eternal cosmic struggle between light and darkness.

In the crucible of the Nightsong, Shadowheart chose to extinguish the light and offered her deed to Shar, embracing loss and darkness fully. Thus she was accepted as Shar’s Chosen — the Dark Justiciar — wielding shadow as both judgment and strength. Shar is the goddess of darkness, loss, forgetfulness, night, and hidden secrets. Her followers embrace pain and concealment, viewing darkness as an essential and empowering force. Shar’s cosmic opposition to Selûne reflects the endless cycle of night prevailing against light, only for light to return again.
